snippet: The Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville, Ark., is trying to find 100 underrecognized artists, culled from a list of more than 10,000, to feature in an ambitious show.
abstract: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville, Ark, is planning ambitious show that will feature 100 underrecognized artists, culled from more than 10,000; event represents museum founder Alice Walton's first attempt to plant her institution's flag firmly in the world of contemporary art; show will inevitably be seen as a kind of heartland response to the Whitney Biennial.
lead_paragraph: The Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art in Bentonville, Ark., is trying to find 100 underrecognized artists, culled from a list of more than 10,000, to feature in an ambitious show.
